Ray Pomponio is a data scientist with seven years of experience in biomedical applications. He received his Master's degree in Biostatistics from the **University of Colorado**, where he developed and applied advanced analytical techniques to biomedical data.

Ray has contributed to several team science collaborations and provided biostatistical expertise/support for grant writing, study design, and longitudinal analysis. He has co-authored 20+ manuscripts in peer-reviewed journals, recently focused on relationships among pulmonary and critical care medical outcomes. He is proficient at programming in `R`, `SAS`, and `Python`, and has experience handling complex datasets, including missing information, time-to-event outcomes, and clustered/correlated data.

Please reach out using any of the links below, or via email: raymond.pomponio (at) outlook.com.
